boat.name: Sauntress
boat.full_description:
'Sauntress' features in a publication from Lodestar Books, 'For the love of Sauntress' by the current owner, Martin O'Scannall, beautifully illustrated with photographs by Oscar Companioni.

She has been sailed without auxiliary power since 1995, formerly based on the English East Coast cruising France, Holland, Norway, South West Ireland and NW Spain where she is currently based (2014). Martin Scannall has built a Will Stirling 8ft general purpose dinghy, made to his plans, to serve as a tender.
boat.construction_details: Pitch pine on steamed and sawn oak, lead ballast keel. No engine since 1994, was Coventry Victor 56hp diesel.
boat.short_description: Sauntress is a 28' gaff cutter built by Wright and Harris, designed by Wright, in 1913, Cardiff, Wales.
